Package com.fcs.pokerserver

Class Game

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.fcs.pokerserver.Game
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    AbstractPlayerListener
    public class Game
extends java.lang.Object
implements AbstractPlayerListener
    An instance of the Game class is created Game to Player play Poker Game. This is the most important file in system.

    • Method Detail

      • startGame

        public void startGame()
        Start Game.
        Throws:
        java.lang.AssertionError - if the total of Players < 2.

      • preflop

        public void preflop()
        Pre-flop play refers to the action that occurs before the flop is dealt. A game begins with the small blind and big blind posting the blinds, and cards are dealt to each player.
        Throws:
        java.lang.AssertionError - if the total of Players < 2.

      • flop

        public void flop()
        the first three community cards that are dealt face-up in the center of the table all at one time. The "flop" also indicates the second round of betting.
        Throws:
        java.lang.AssertionError - if the next round of the Player is not Ready

      • turn

        public void turn()
        In turn games, this is the fourth card deal. It is the third round of betting
        Throws:
        java.lang.AssertionError - Next Round of Player is ready

      • river

        public void river()
        This is the last card given in all games.
        Throws:
        java.lang.AssertionError - Next Round of Player is ready.

      • endGame

        public void endGame()
        Finish the game. Show the winner Player.
